result.markdown: --- draft: true editor: visual title: Oregon grape - seasonal variations date: 2023-03-13 author: Kath Quayle categories: - news - bees - weather - phenology image: images/OG seasonal.jpg --- Reading time: <1 minute ## Seasonal Variations: 2021 versus 2022 ### Data collection ![](images/paste-5A95A9C4.png){width="41"}Weather data collected continuously with Acurite Atlas weather station ![](images/paste-0B39D167.png){width="41"}Time lapse photography Time lapse photography 2021: pictures taken every minute from sunrise to sunset 2022: pictures taken every 15s from sunrise to sunset\ Camera 1 - April 3rd to May 4th\ Camera 2 - April 12th to April 26th ![](images/paste-C0B29963.png){width="41"}Video 2021 only Video capture of 4 minutes out of every 5 from peak blooming to end of flowering ## Phenology ## ![](images/paste-6511194E.png) Temperature trends ## ![](images/paste-D29DE0F2.png){width="439"} Rainfall ## ![](images/paste-A8968AE2.png) ## Bee counts Best estimates of bee visits to the Oregon grape patch were derived from the time-lapse and video data. Overall similar numbers of bees came to feed both years despite quite varying weather patterns. ## Summary ![](images/paste-A837B944.png){width="456"}
